[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@rushstack/playwright-browser-tunnel](./playwright-browser-tunnel.md)

## playwright-browser-tunnel package

Run a Playwright browser server in one environment and drive it from another environment by forwarding Playwright's WebSocket traffic through a tunnel.

## Remarks

This package is intended for remote development and CI scenarios (for example: Codespaces, devcontainers, or a separate "browser host" machine) where you want tests to run in one environment but the actual browser process to run in another.

The package provides two main APIs: - [PlaywrightTunnel](./playwright-browser-tunnel.playwrighttunnel.md) - Run on the browser host to launch the real browser server and forward messages - [tunneledBrowserConnection()](./playwright-browser-tunnel.tunneledbrowserconnection.md) - Run on the test runner to create a local endpoint that your Playwright client can connect to

<table><thead><tr><th>

Class


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[LaunchOptionsValidator](./playwright-browser-tunnel.launchoptionsvalidator.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** Validates Playwright launch options against security allowlists. Provides utilities for managing client-side allowlist configuration.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[PlaywrightTunnel](./playwright-browser-tunnel.playwrighttunnel.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** Hosts a Playwright browser server and forwards traffic over a WebSocket tunnel.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[createTunneledBrowserAsync(browserName, launchOptions, logger, port)](./playwright-browser-tunnel.createtunneledbrowserasync.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** Creates a Playwright Browser instance connected via a tunneled WebSocket connection.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** Normalizes an error to a string for logging purposes.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[isExtensionInstalledAsync()](./playwright-browser-tunnel.isextensioninstalledasync.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** Helper to determine if the Playwright Local Browser Server extension is installed. This checks for the existence of a well-known file in the OS temp directory.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[tunneledBrowserConnection(logger, port, playwrightVersion)](./playwright-browser-tunnel.tunneledbrowserconnection.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** Creates a tunneled WebSocket endpoint that a local Playwright client can connect to.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
